# Aufgabe

Importieren Sie den Datensatz `mariokart` in R.
Filtern Sie die *neuen* Spiele.
Berechnen Sie die Korrelation von Verkaufspreis (`total_pr`) und Startgebot (`start_pr`)!

Hinweise:

- Runden Sie auf 2 Dezimalstellen.


</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>

# Lösung

Pakete starten:


::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr2_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_00c01f44d4f86b7ecc3712257c93c229'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(easystats)
```
:::



Daten importieren:


::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr2_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_d4d30644cba3950104447ab640b78351'}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_url <- "https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/csv/openintro/mariokart.csv"
d <- data_read(d_url)
```
:::



Oder so:


::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr2_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_202b91c7a7c92abe7ca39a91b62f4c3b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
data(mariokart, package = "openintro")
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr2_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_10df3ebc0bcc144d39fba4fa36b44c62'}

```{.r .cell-code}
solution <- 
d  %>% 
  filter(cond == "new") %>% 
  summarise(pr_cor = cor(total_pr, start_pr))
solution
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
    pr_cor
1 0.405102
```
:::
:::



Alternativ kann man (komfortabel) die Korrelation z.B. so berechnen:


::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr2_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_bdc1524791e0189864764a5fd3289866'}

```{.r .cell-code}
d %>% 
  select(start_pr, total_pr, cond) %>% 
  filter(cond == "new") %>% 
  correlation()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# Correlation Matrix (pearson-method)

Parameter1 | Parameter2 |    r |       95% CI | t(57) |       p
---------------------------------------------------------------
start_pr   |   total_pr | 0.41 | [0.17, 0.60] |  3.35 | 0.001**

p-value adjustment method: Holm (1979)
Observations: 59
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr2_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_d0a17dffc896f3c6a067ed58454c4996'}

:::


**Lösung:** 0.41.
